  • Speed
  • Spirit

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Silence overcomes the target, whether from the warping of sound around the target, or from a physical effect like strangulation or suffocation. The silence bane is a favorite among assassins, sorcerers, engineers, and mad scientists.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: If Power or Speed is used to inflict this bane, then the character is suffering strangulation and unable to speak. If the bane is inflicted using Spirit, then all sound within 1 hex of the target is suppressed through extraordinary means, making their footsteps and the usual clank of belongings they are carrying inaudible.

docs.title: Silencing Strike
docs.text: Cost: 3

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Like an expert assassin or ninja, you can render your foes completely unable to alert others of your presence. This might take the form of a dart to the larynx, a garrote around the throat, or simply a sturdy covering of the mouth.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: Whenever you deal damage using a weapon with the precise property to a target that is caught off guard or otherwise unaware of the attack, such as when you are hidden from them, disguised as a friend, or have successfully deceived them, the target is afflicted with the silenced bane.

docs.title: Skill Specialization (I - V)
docs.text: Cost: 2 per tier

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You have the eyes of an eagle, the endurance of an ox, the guile of a fox, or some similarly exceptional non-combat talent. It might come from intense training, prolonged study, or even an inherent natural talent.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: Choose one attribute. Any time you make a roll using the chosen attribute that is not for initiative, attacks, invocations, or the defend action, you gain advantage 1 on the roll per tier of this feat you possess for that attribute.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 1
  • Invocation Time: 1 Major Action
  • Duration: Resist ends (Fail x 3 = 1 minute)

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text:
• Power
  • Speed
  • Spirit

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The target's movement is impaired, either by extreme cold, prolonged heat, poison, or injury to one or both legs. This bane is a favored attack among rogues, ice mages, telekinetisists, and gunslingers.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: The afflicted target's speed is reduced to half its current speed, rounded down to the nearest 1 hex increment. This applies to all movement that is physical (flight, walking, climbing, etc.). If the target is currently under a magical effect that increases speed, the two effects are canceled for the duration that both affect the target.

docs.title: Special Attacks
docs.text:
Special attacks are attacks empowered by essence abilities. If you have the Fire essence, that doesn't mean you can make an attack utilizing it. A special attack will grant an ability that channels that essence into a type of attack, giving it form.

A special attack should specify:

  1. The type of attack (Melee, Ranged, or Magic)
  2. The defense score it targets (Guard, Toughness, or Resolve)
  3. Whether multi-targeting applies and in what form, for instance:
    • A melee swing that goes in a frontal arc
    • A fireball filling a radius
    • A hail of arrows in a cone

docs.title: Extraordinary Items
docs.text:
These are items with magical or advanced technological properties. They are acquired via questing, crafting, or purchase (with GM approval) and have a Wealth Level.

  • Item Attributes/Banes/Boons: An item can possess its own attribute scores, or the ability to invoke specific banes and boons at a set attribute score. The wielder uses the item's score for the roll. If the wielder's own score is higher, they may use it instead and gain advantage 1.
  • Key Properties:
    • Augmenting: Applies a bane to a weapon attack. Consumed on use.
    • Autonomous: Triggers a specific action under a pre-set condition.
    • Baneful (Bane): On a damaging attack that exceeds the target's defense by 5+, you may automatically inflict the specified bane.
    • Consumable: Can be used once to automatically invoke a single-target boon.
    • Cursed (Bane): Afflicts the wielder with a bane that cannot be resisted normally.
    • Deadly (X): Grants advantage X on attacks made with the weapon.
    • Persistent (Boon): The item automatically invokes and sustains the specified boon for the wielder.
    • Weapon/Armor (Type): The item functions as a standard weapon or armor of the specified type, inheriting its base properties.

docs.title: Legendary Items
docs.text:
These are unique, plot-central items that are too powerful to show up for sale in marketplaces.

  • They can have any property of an extraordinary item, plus unique legendary properties:
  • Attribute Bonus/Penalty: Directly modifies the wielder's attribute score.
  • Intelligent: The item is sentient and can communicate.
  • Unfailing: Any die result of 1 is treated as the maximum value and explodes.
  • Slaying (Creature Type): On an attack that exceeds the target's defense by 5+, the target creature of the specified type immediately dies.

docs.title: Speed
docs.text:
Speed is one of the four Attributes. It is used to determine how fast a character can move, what order they take in initiative, and for their ability to dodge attacks.

Examples:

  • Dodge an attack
  • Flying or teleportation boons
  • Move at speed
  • Determine order in initiative

docs.title: Movement Speed
docs.text:
Calculation: 2 + Speed attribute score

Movement speed is the distance a character can move in a single move action

docs.title: Spirit
docs.text:
Spirit is one of the four Attributes. It is used in situations where a character needs to endure magical attacks or perform solely magical deeds.

Examples:

  • Endure magic damage
  • Decipher a ritual diagram
  • Identify an item and its relevant command phrases

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 5
  • Invocation Time: 10 Minutes
  • Duration: 10 minutes (special)

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text: • Spirit

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Either through innate extrasensory perception or a special conduit such as a computer terminal, bubbling cauldron, or a crystal ball, you can view the target from a distance.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
You can spy on a person or area that you are familiar with. The power level of this bane determines the maximum distance between you and the target. If successfully invoked, you can see and hear everything that goes on within a 12 hex radius of your target. Anyone within the targeted area who has a Resolve defense score higher than your Spirit action roll to invoke this bane becomes aware of an unseen presence in the area (regardless of whether or not you succeed at the roll). Certain creatures may be able to identify your spying if they are familiar with such powers.

  • Power Level 5 - 1 mile or less
  • Power Level 6 - 100 miles or less
  • Power Level 7 - More than 100 miles, but on the same dimension or plane of reality
  • Power Level 9 - Any dimension or plane of reality. (Peering into certain dimensions may expose you to other dangers at the GM's discretion).

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 4
  • Invocation Time: 1 Major Action
  • Duration: Resist ends (Fail x 3 = 1 minute)

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text:
• Power
  • Speed
  • Spirit

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You disorient the target's senses, causing them to act much less efficiently. Stunning an enemy can be caused by attacks such as a pistol whip to the back of the head, a kick in the groin, and a deafening thunderclap.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: During the target's turn, they are limited to either a single major action, a single move action, or a single minor action. Effects that grant additional actions do not circumvent this unless they grant a free action. Note that a target expending its move action to resist this bane will receive the remainder of their usual actions if the resist roll succeeds.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 7
  • Invocation Time: 1 Major Action
  • Duration: Resist ends (Fail x 3 = 1 minute)

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text: • Spirit

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The stupefied bane has examples in many stories and legends: a vampire's eyes, a siren's song, and a nymph's beauty are all known to cast a stupor upon weak-willed mortals. Being stupefied causes the target to be lulled into a false sense of security, tranquility, and pacifism.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: The target is in a state of mental fog, lowering their mental defenses. While stupefied, the target's Resolve defense is reduced to 10. In addition, the target has the approximate intelligence of a child. If attacked, it will defend itself until the attack ceases using its natural weapons, but the target will never employ any kind of complex tactic or ability, such as spellcasting. If the target sees fire, it will run away. If it feels pain, it will flee.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 4
  • Invocation Time: 1 Focus Action
  • Duration: Sustain Persists

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You summon forth a creature to assist your cause, whether they are animals called from the wild, undead minions built from the remains of your foes, or worker bots constructed of spare parts from a salvage yard. This boon is favored by druids, conjurers, engineers, necromancers, and mad scientists.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
You create or summon a temporary NPC companion that is under your control, though of limited intelligence. Your minion's statistics are determined by the power level of this boon. You may assign the attributes as you see fit. Your minion's attributes do not affect their hit points or defenses.

Power Level Hit Points Defenses Attributes 4 4 11 2, 1, 1 5 5 12 3, 2, 2 6 6 13 4, 3, 3 7 7 14 5, 4, 4 8 8 15 6, 5, 5 9 9 16 7, 6, 6

Your minion cannot act on the turn that it is summoned. On each of your following turns, your minion acts on your initiative count according to your direction, receiving the usual assortment of actions. You are limited to a maximum number of summoned creatures equal to your invoking attribute score. Feats and other abilities cannot increase this limit.

docs.title: Superior Concentration (I - III)
docs.text: Cost: 3 per tier

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Your powers of focus are exceptionally honed, allowing you to maintain concentration on multiple extraordinary effects at once. This feat is typical among character concepts built to enhance themselves or their allies, such as bards, platoon leaders, or engineers.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: When you take the sustain a boon minor action, you may sustain one additional boon per tier of this feat which you possess.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 3
  • Invocation Time: 1 Major Action
  • Duration: 24 hours

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You protect the target from environmental dangers or suspend their usual biological needs. Examples include sprouting gills to allow for underwater breathing, calling on a divine power to be sustained without food, and using far-future biomodifications to endure extreme cold.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
You protect the target from one environmental danger, biological need, or similar condition. The power level of this boon determines the type of conditions you may protect against.

  • Power Level 3 - Target is unaffected by a chosen type of hostile climate. Examples include heat, cold, and radiation.
  • Power Level 4 - Target can sustain a single biological need from an alternate source, such as by breathing the oxygen found in water, drinking from an irradiated stream, or eating food not normally edible
  • Power Level 5 - Target can subsist without the essential nourishment periodically required for sustenance, such as food or water.
  • Power Level 7 - Target can subsist without the most critical nourishment, that which is typically consumed on a moment-to-moment basis, such as air.
  • Power Level 9 - Target is unaffected even when cut off from all biological necessities, including warmth, water, air, food, and any other biological need.

docs.title: Swimming
docs.text: Cost: 1

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You are made for the water and can swim at surprising speeds with the aptitude of a fish. This might be the result of hard core training, or it may stem from a racial trait, such as webbed feet and hands.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: You gain a swimming speed equal to your base speed and do not need to make any special action rolls to maintain this base speed.

docs.title: Sworn Enemy (I - IX)
docs.text: Cost: 1 per tier

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You are expertly focused on dealing with a particular species, race, or faction. Perhaps your family was slain by werewolves, and you have devoted your life to studying their mannerisms in order to hunt them down. Or maybe you were raised in a prison on the third moon of Vogax Prime, and you know the Vogans better than they know themselves.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: Choose a species, race, or faction (e.g., dragons, Void Templars, gnolls, or vampires). You learn the primary conversational language of that species, and at the GM's discretion, you may have some level of access to other special forms of communication (such as thieves' cant or secret hand signals). Furthermore, you gain advantage 1 per tier of this feat to all attribute rolls to learn things pertaining to your chosen group.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 3
  • Invocation Time: 1 Major Action
  • Duration: Sustain Persists

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You reach out and extraordinarily control an unattended inanimate object. This may stem from latent psychic ability, magical manipulation of the element of air, anti-gravity technology, or similar sources.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
Immediately upon invoking the boon, and again each round when you sustain the boon, you may move the target object up to 1 hex times your invoking attribute score. As part of moving an object, you may also manipulate it (for example, turning a door knob or opening a coin purse). A new invocation of this boon must be attempted whenever you wish to target a different object. The power level of the boon determines the size and weight of the objects you may target:

  • Power Level 3 - The object must be smaller than a 1' cube or lighter than 10 pounds.
  • Power Level 5 - The object must be smaller than a 1 hex area or lighter than 100 pounds.
  • Power Level 7 - The object must be smaller than a 2 hex area or lighter than 1,000 pounds.
  • Power Level 9 - The object must be smaller than a 4 hex area or lighter than 10,000 pounds.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 3
  • Invocation Time: 1 Major Action
  • Duration: Sustain Persists

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You reach out mentally to a willing target and speak wordlessly with thought-to-thought communication. Examples of this boon in action include a psychic who can connect with the minds of others and a far future artificial intelligence capable of passing information to other beings through the vibration of quantum strings.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
You and the target can communicate with each other simply through thought. Note that this telepathy does not bestow intelligence upon creatures, so you could not use it to communicate with a squirrel unless you already possessed other means of doing so. Additionally, telepathy does not bypass language barriers, so you would need to already speak the language of your target.

  • Power Level 3 - You can communicate telepathically with a single creature of animal-level intelligence or lower. Keep in mind that it can only communicate concepts with you that it can understand.
  • Power Level 5 - You can communicate telepathically with a single creature of humanoid intelligence.
  • Power Level 6 - You can create a mental relay between yourself and up to five other creatures allowing each of them to communicate with the rest of the group simultaneously.
  • Power Level 7 - You can communicate telepathically with any number of creatures that you can see.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 3
  • Invocation Time: 1 Move Action
  • Duration: Instantaneous

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You are able to instantly move yourself or an ally from one place to another, either by stepping into an intermediate realm, deconstructing and reforming a physical body, transporting magically, or similar means.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
• Power Level 3 - You can teleport the target to any unoccupied space within 5 feet per Speed or Spirit attribute score as long as you can naturally see your destination.
  • Power Level 5 - Your teleportation range is unchanged, but you can now teleport your target to spaces that you can't see. If you choose an occupied space, your target lands in the nearest adjacent space (roll randomly to decide if there are multiple options) and your target is stunned for 1 round (a resist roll is not needed to end the effect).
  • Power Level 7 - You can opt to take longer in invoking the boon. If you choose to do so, for each minute of invocation (delay before making your action roll) you can teleport the target 1 mile, up to a maximum number of miles equal to your Speed or Spirit attribute score. While the distance is greater, this mode is also dangerous, as a misunderstanding of direction or geography can put your target many miles in an unfavorable direction. You simply choose a direction (relative to your starting location) and teleport your target a number of miles equal to your Speed or Spirit score. During invocation, you must spend a focus action each turn until the invocation time passes.
  • Power Level 9 - Using the same longer invocation time for power level 7, you can now teleport your target to any location without range limit, provided you have personally seen (through magical or normal means) the destination.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 5
  • Invocation Time: 10 Minutes
  • Duration: Sustain Persists

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You or an ally temporarily gains the ability to read, write, and speak languages that they are otherwise unfamiliar with. This ability may come by channeling interplanar spirits, tapping the power of a super intelligence, making deductions based on an extraordinary understanding of the science of communication, or similar means.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
• Power Level 5 - Your target can understand and speak a language of your choice.
  • Power Level 6 - Your target can read a language of your choice.

docs.title: Tough as Nails (I - II)
docs.text: Cost: 2 per tier

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You have a remarkable ability to shrug off pain and punishment that would take down lesser heroes. This power might stem from your rocky carapace, extreme combat training, or simply an extra dose of grit that you acquired from a hard life.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: You permanently gain 5 extra hit points per tier of this feat you possess.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 3
  • Invocation Time: 1 Minute
  • Duration: Sustain Persists

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You are able to change the size, shape, and composition of physical matter that you touch. Transmute rocks to gold, a wall into a door, or a lump of metal into a loaded gun. This boon is favored among druids, transmuters, engineers, and mad scientists.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
Your power level determines the types of matter you can transmute as well as the duration of the effect. The duration is either temporary or permanent. A temporary transmutation must be sustained every round. A permanent transmutation does not have to be sustained and persists until some other effect would cancel it. The maximum volume of matter you can transmute is on 5 cubic feet multiplied by your attribute score.

  • Power Level 3 - Temporarily transmute an object into another object of the same size and weight.
  • Power Level 5 - Temporarily transmute an object into another object of the same size and 50% greater or lesser weight. Temporarily transmute an object into another object of the same weight and 50% greater or lesser size.
  • Power Level 7 - Permanently transmute an object into another object of the same size and weight. Temporarily transmute an object into another object of the same size and 200% greater or lesser weight. Temporarily transmute an object into another object of the same weight and 200% greater or lesser size.
  • Power Level 8 - Permanently transmute an object into another object of up to 200% difference in size and/or weight. Temporarily transmute a simple object into a mundane object of notable complexity. The resulting object must be of Wealth Level 2 or less.
  • Power Level 9 - Permanently transmute a simple object into a mundane and complex one. The resulting object must be of Wealth Level 2 or less.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 5
  • Invocation Time: 1 Major Action
  • Duration: Sustain Persists

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You grant yourself or an ally the ability to perceive that which cannot be detected with mundane senses, piercing impediments that would block or deceive normal sight, including darkness, solid objects, illusions, and even the barrier between alternate planes of reality. This power may stem from extrasensory perception, divine blessing, cybernetically enhanced senses, or similar means.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text:
• Power Level 5 - The target sees the presence of extraordinary effects such as magic, cloaking technology, and other effects that could be seen through extra-visual perception. In addition, this boon grants advantage 1 on rolls used to detect mundane concealment such as hidden passages, furniture with hidden storage, and concealed traps or other hazards.
  • Power Level 6 - The target's extraordinary sight pierces natural and magical darkness.
  • Power Level 7 - The target's extraordinary sight pierces through all illusory effects, allowing them to see a phantasm for what it is.
  • Power Level 8 - The target can see through solid objects and their natural visual range is unhindered by them.
  • Power Level 9 - The extraordinary sight enables the target to peer into alternate planes or dimensions. They can see into dimensional pockets and other planes that overlap with the one they are currently on. In addition, the target's visual range becomes supercharged.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Min. Power Level: 5
  • Invocation Time: 10 Minutes
  • Duration: 10 minutes (special)

docs.title: Attributes
docs.text: • Spirit

docs.title: Description
docs.text: By controlling the target's mind through compulsion magic, chemical injection, neural probes, or similar means, you render them incapable of lying deliberately. This is a favored bane among enchanters, mad scientists, psychics, and thought police.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: The target answers any question asked with honesty, to the best of their knowledge. When compelled to reveal something they would not reveal outside of duress, the target makes a Recovery roll and you make an Spirit roll. If the target's roll is higher than yours, then they resist the bane and the effect ends.

docs.title: Turn Actions
docs.text:
On your turn, you can take: - 1 Major Action - 1 Move Action - Any number of unique Minor Actions

Alternatively, you can forgo all of the above to take 1 Focus Action.

docs.title: Major Actions
docs.text:
• Make a Damaging Attack:
    • Damage = (Attack Roll Total) - (Target's Defense). Minimum damage is the attribute score for the attacking attribute
    • Exceptional Success: If your roll exceeds the target's defense by 10 or more, you can apply a bane or cancel a boon on the target.
  • Make a Bane Attack: Roll an appropriate attribute against the target's relevant defense. On a success, the target suffers the bane.
  • Invoke a Boon: Roll an attribute against the CR from the Boon Challenge Rating table. Your roll determines the maximum power level you can invoke, capped by your attribute score.
  • Assist an Ally: Grant an ally advantage 1 on an action roll.
  • Take an Extra Move Action: You can trade your Major Action for a second Move Action.

docs.title: Multi-Targeting
docs.text:
Attacking multiple targets incurs disadvantage.

  • Melee: Disadvantage equal to the number of targets.
  • Ranged: Disadvantage equal to the number of targets (max 5 targets within a 2 radius sphere).
  • Area (Typically Magic):
  • Single Target: No disadvantage
  • Area targeting has 3 modes:
    • Sphere: Originates on in the middle of a hex within range. Radius is the number of neighboring rings of hexes are included.
    • Disadvantage = 2 * Radius
    • Cone: Originates on the caster's hex, but does not impact that hex, and forms a triangle a chosen direction that forms a triangle with 2 additional hexes.
    • Disadvantage = 1 for the smallest possible triangle, +1 for each additional row of hexes added
    • Line:: Originates on the caster's hex, but does not impact that hex, and forms a line in a chosen direction, which must be directly toward an adjacent hex.
    • Disadvantage = 1 for every 2 hex tiles added in that line.

docs.title: Move Actions
docs.text:
• Move up to your speed.
  • Take special movement (Jump, Climb, Swim).
  • Resist Banes: You can use an action to try to resist a bane. For instance, if you are on fire and have an ability to conjure water, you can try to put yourself out by conjuring water. Make an action roll for your ability against the CR of the rank of the bane you which to resist. If you have no valid abilities to use, you can still make a roll using a d20 to try to resist it with a straight roll.

docs.title: Minor Actions
docs.text:
You can take any number of unique minor actions, for instance, you cannot take two opportunity attacks in one round. Your minor actions refresh at the start of your turn.

  • Opportunity Attack: if an enemy leaves your melee reach, you may make an attack against them.
  • Sustain a Boon: Use a minor action to continue a boon with a "sustain persists" duration for another round. You can typically only sustain one boon at a time.
  • Other examples: Draw/sheathe a weapon, retrieve an item, open a door.

docs.title: Focus Actions
docs.text:
Requires forgoing all other actions for the turn.

  • Superior Action: Make any one action roll with advantage 1.
  • Charge: Move up to twice your speed and make one melee attack with disadvantage 1.

docs.title: Interrupt Actions
docs.text:
Can be taken in response to another's action, but costs your next Major Action.

  • Defend: After an enemy's successful attack, make an attribute roll. If your roll is higher, it replaces the targeted defense score for that attack.
  • Improvise: Take a reasonable non-offensive action to react to a situation, with GM approval.

docs.title: Two Weapon Brute
docs.text: Cost: 3

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Being both physically powerful and incredibly agile, you are able to wield a weapon in one-hand that requires two hands for others. Good examples of this feat in action include an orcish barbarian wielding a great axe and shield and a survivor in the zombie apocalypse wielding two chainsaws.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: You can wield weapons with the two-handed property in one hand and you gain the benefits of both the two-handed and one-handed property while doing so. This means that you gain a total of advantage 2 when wielding a two-handed weapon in each hand, advantage 1 from the power of a two-handed weapon plus advantage 1 from having one weapon in each hand.

docs.title: Two Weapon Defense
docs.text: Cost: 2

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Your mastery of two weapon fighting allows you not only to come at your foes with a flurry of attacks, but also to shield yourself exceptionally well by deflecting incoming attacks with your weapons. Duelists, rangers, and space pirates are all concepts that could make use of this feat.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: When you wield a weapon you've taken the Attack Specialization feat for in each hand, you gain a +1 armor bonus to your Guard defense.

docs.title: Unending Charm
docs.text: Cost: 3

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Whether you are an enchanter, psychic, or mad scientist, you have mastered the art of enthralling others. Your charms are so potent that your victims may fall permanently under your compulsion.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: When you invoke the charmed bane, targets who do not make their resist roll within 24 hours of being afflicted become permanently affected by the bane. They do not receive any more resist rolls to shake themselves free of the effect. Other extraordinary effects like a nullify bane can still end the effect (and other methods may work at the GM's discretion).

docs.title: Untrackable
docs.text: Cost: 1

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Whether this power manifests itself as vines that grow in your wake, a magical ward against detection, or an illusory veil, the effect is the same: you are protected from being tracked.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: Your travel is veiled by special means that conceal your tracks and any evidence of your passage even after you are far away. It is impossible to follow your tracks except by extraordinary means.

docs.title: Vicious Strike
docs.text: Cost: 2

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Whether through brute force, lethal precision, or volatile magic, a deadly attack delivered by you is exceptionally vicious. Berserkers, assassins, and superheroes of exceptional combat skill are all good examples of this feat in play.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: Any time you roll a natural 20 on the d20 for an attack action roll, you get advantage 1 on all subsequent d20 re-rolls granted by dice explosions.

docs.title: Wealthy
docs.text: Cost: 3

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Whether you were born into nobility, come from old money, are heir to a great treasure, or simply a well-established merchant, you are wealthier than the average adventurer.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: Your wealth score is increased by 1.

docs.title: Weapon Categories & Effects
docs.text:
• One-Handed Melee: Wielding a one-handed weapon in each hand (neither with the defensive property) grants advantage 1 on all melee attacks.
  • Two-Handed Melee: Requires two hands and grants advantage 1 on all attacks.
  • Versatile Melee: Can be used one-handed or two-handed, gaining the benefits of the current mode.
  • Ranged: Can attack up to their range increment without penalty.
    • Attacks up to 2x range increment suffer disadvantage 1.
    • Attacks up to 3x range increment suffer disadvantage 2.
    • Attacks beyond 3x range are not possible.

docs.title: Key Weapon Properties
docs.text:
• Area: The weapon makes area attacks of a set size and does not incur multi-targeting penalties.
  • Defensive (X): Grants advantage X on defend actions and a +1 armor bonus to Guard. Negates the standard advantage from one-handed/two-handed fighting styles.
  • Delayed Ready: Can only be used once per round and requires a move action to ready beforehand.
  • Forceful: Can use the Power attribute for attacks.
  • Precise: Can use the Speed attribute for attacks.
  • Reach: Extends melee range by 1 hex.
  • Slow: Disadvantage 2 on initiative rolls.
  • Swift: Advantage 2 on initiative rolls.

docs.title: Weapon Banes
docs.text:
Weapons can list specific banes they excel at inflicting.

  • You can choose to try to inflict the bane instead of dealing damage
  • The required attribute score for invoking the bane is treated as one lower.
  • You gain advantage 1 on the bane attack roll.

docs.title: Well-Rounded
docs.text: Cost: 2

docs.title: Description
docs.text: You have a versatile education, a wide range of experiences, or just plain old good luck. The result is that you're pretty good at things you're not specialized in.

docs.title: Effect
docs.text: Any time you use an attribute with a score of 2 or less to make an action roll outside of combat that is not a bane or boon invocation, you gain advantage 1 to the roll.
